text: Edmund C. Berkeley, an actuary at the Prudential Insurance Company, wrote a report about possible applications of electro mechanical calculation to large commercial data-processing needs.
Telegraph lines opened between Los Angeles and San Francisco. This allowed gold miners to tell backers farther south that they still hadn't found any gold.
KDKA radio in Pittsburgh conducted the first live broadcast of a football game from Forbes Field. The University of Pittsburgh beat West Virginia University.
To allow IT departments to prepare for critical updates, Microsoft conducted the first regularly scheduled Windows patch release. It became lovingly known as "Patch Tuesday".
